Package com.intersys.globals.graphapi

GraphAPI implements a typical graph API, except that this graph API is persisted using InterSystems globals database.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Graph<TNode extends GraphNode> Graph presents a collection of graph nodes but also has an attached list of edges among those nodes
GraphComponent Common interface used to provide extension points to nodes and edges
GraphEdge<TNode extends GraphNode> GraphEdge connects two nodes in the context of a graph
GraphNode<forType> Node presents a simple interface for a node in a graph.
GraphPath<NdType extends GraphNode> A Path looks like an Edge (extends Edge) but also contains a list of constituent Edges
 

Exception Summary
EdgeCannotConnectInPath Caller tried to add an Edge to the Path that is not continous with one or other end of Path
GraphDuplicateNodeLabelException  
GraphException GraphException indicates the programmer has made a logical error in using the graph.
InvalidNodesException This exception indicates there is an inconsistency between one or mode nodes that the caller has attempted to use in the context of a particular graph
NodesNotInGraphException The caller has attempted to use a Node in a Graph to which it has not been explicitly added.
 

Package com.intersys.globals.graphapi Description

GraphAPI implements a typical graph API, except that this graph API is persisted using InterSystems globals database. Please see the class diagram for a visual overview.

Interfaces

The interfaces for graphapi are the basics, implemented as generics, as follows:
  • Node - some Object we want to graph
  • Graph - which contains the Nodes
  • Edge - connects two Nodes in the context of the Graph

Requirements and Objectives

  • present as simple a Graph interface as possible
  • allow but not require a Graph be persisted in GlobalsDB
  • allow Nodes to participate independently in multiple Graphs
  • allow the use of any Java class as a graph node
  • support directed graphs
  • support weighted edges
  • support subgraphs with reference to 'supergraphs'
  • implement cycle detection
  • implement shortest-path calculation
  • support direct rendering by graphviz
